DataElement.preferredName: DART Currently Feel Nausea Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of their current feeling of nausea, using an 11 point visual analogue scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Distress Assessment and Response Tool Current Feel Nausea Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._A question about whether an individual feels or felt nausea._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Concepts.definition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:A question about whether an individual feels or felt nausea.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.origin: DART:Distress Assessment and Response Tool, Form D-5668. University Health Network DART Team, Toronto, Canada, 3/2013.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret MBO request 11.8.17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._A nausea scale from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of nausea experienced._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0 on a nausea scale that ranges from 0: No Nausea to 10: Worst Possible Nausea.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 0 on a nausea scale that ranges from 0: No Nausea to 10: Worst Possible Nausea.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.:A nausea scale from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of nausea experienced.:An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

A nausea scale from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of nausea experienced.
